titleStmt.title: Thomas E. Bramlette, 1st Lieutenant and Mustering Officer, Charles Hayden
CWG13619

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

msIdentifier.collection: Active Militia Records - Capital Guards, North Cumberland Btn., and Three Forks Btn.
msIdentifier.idno: Box 76, Folder 864-865Â 1st REGT CAPITAL GUARDS FRANKFORT BATTALION Oaths & Commissions of officers

body.p:
UNITED WE STAND
DIVIDED WE FALL
State of Kentucky
EXECUTIVE DEPARTMENT
Frankfort March 4th 1865

The Adjutant General will issue a commission to Charles Haydon as 1s Lt and Mustering Officer of the state, to bear date 23d Jany 1864, stipulating in Said commission that his pay is to be $100 per month.

Thos E Bramlette
Gov of Ky,,

Executive Department
Frankfort Ky
March 4th 1865
Bramlette Thos. E.
Gov. of Ky.
The Adjt Genl will issue a commission to Chas Haydon as 1" Lt. and Mustering officer of the state, to bear date 23 Jany. 1864, stipulating in said commission that his pay is to be $100 per month --

Issue
D W Lindsey
Adj Genl.

Com issd & deld
Mar 14. 1865
Recd A. G. O. Ky 14 Mar. 1865
